ch.nolix.element.font

Class Font

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.core.entity.Entity
      • ch.nolix.element.core.Element
        • ch.nolix.element.font.Font
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Typed, TypeRequestable, Specified

    public final class Font
extends Element
    A font can paint texts with a specific -text font -text style -text size -text color A font is not mutable.
    Author:
    Silvan Wyss

      • getFirstPart

        public java.lang.String getFirstPart(java.lang.String text,
                                     int maxWidth)
        Parameters:
        text -
        maxWidth -
        Returns:
        the first part of the given text the current Font can paint that is not longer than the given max width.
        Throws:
        NegativeArgumentException - if the given max width is negative.

      • getFirstPart

        public java.lang.String getFirstPart(java.lang.String text,
                                     int maxWidth,
                                     boolean attachEllipsis)
        Parameters:
        text -
        maxWidth -
        ellipsis -
        Returns:
        the first part of the given text the current Font can paint, that is not longer than the given max width, optionally with an ellipsis if the given text is longer than the given max width.

      • getFirstPartWithProbableEllipsis

        public java.lang.String getFirstPartWithProbableEllipsis(java.lang.String text,
                                                         int maxWidth)
        Parameters:
        text -
        maxWidth -
        Returns:
        the first part of the given text the current Font can paint, that is not longer than the given max width, with an ellipsis if the given text is longer than the given max width.
        Throws:
        NegativeArgumentException - if the given max width is negative.

      • getTextHeight

        public final int getTextHeight()
        The text size is normative. The text height depends on the text font and can differ.
        Returns:
        the text height of the current Font.

      • getSwingTextWidth

        public final int getSwingTextWidth(java.lang.String text)
        Returns:
        the width of the given text when the current Font would be applied to it.

      • paintSwingText

        public void paintSwingText(java.lang.String text,
                           int maxWidth,
                           java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        Lets the current Font paint the given text using the given graphics. Only the first part of the given text that is not longer than the given max width will be painted.
        Parameters:
        text -
        graphics -

      • paintSwingText

        public void paintSwingText(java.lang.String text,
                           int maxWidth,
                           java.awt.Graphics graphics,
                           int xPosition,
                           int yPosition)
        Lets the current Font paint the given text at the given position using the given graphics. Only the first part of the given text that is not longer than the given max width will be painted.
        Parameters:
        text -
        maxWidth -
        graphics -
        xPosition -
        yPosition -
        Throws:
        NegativeArgumentException - if the given max width is negative.
